2. Ipse cum legatis circumire] In the Roman camp watches were kept at each of the four gates, and these were relieved every three hours; so that there were four sets in the night. And, to keep the men on the watch strictly to their duty, there was a circuitio vigilum, or a visiting of the watcli, performed four times every night. This. for a long time, was the business of the T ribunes3 at length they were allowed to execute this piece of their office by deputies; and at last a set of meu were appointed for the purpose, called circuitores. This circuitio Metellus and his lieute· nants take the trouble of themselves.

3. Exercitum brevi confirmavit] Confirmat exercitum, qui eum firmum reddit adversus hostem.
